owner."},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. depositERC20(bytes32,((address,uint256),.details: Deposit ERC20 tokens for a specific link ID using Permit2

params.linkId: The UUID (bytes32) of the link to credit the deposit to

depositERC20For(bytes32,address,address,.details: Deposit ERC20 tokens for a specific link ID (for contract calls, without Permit2)

params.amount: The amount of tokens to deposit
params.from: The address to transfer tokens from
params.linkId: The UUID (bytes32) of the link to credit the deposit to

depositETH(bytes32).details: Receive ETH and track it for a specific link ID

params.linkId: The UUID (bytes32) of the link to credit the deposit to

depositETHFor(bytes32,address).details: Deposit ETH for a specific link ID on behalf of another address (for contract calls)

params.from: The address to record as the depositor
params.linkId: The UUID (bytes32) of the link to credit the deposit to

eip712Domain().details: returns the fields and values that describe the domain separator used by this contract for EIP-712 signature.

params.recipient: The address to receive the tokens/ETH

getLinkBalance(bytes32,address).details: Get the balance of a specific token for a link ID

returns._0: The balance of the token for the link

isTransferIdUsed(bytes32).details: Check if a transfer ID (UUID) has been used

params.transferId: The UUID (bytes32) transfer ID to check

returns._0: True if the transfer ID has been used

isWithdrawIdUsed(bytes32).details: Check if a withdraw ID (UUID) has been used

params.withdrawId: The UUID (bytes32) withdraw ID to check

returns._0: True if the withdraw ID has been used

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferLinkBalances(bytes32,address,uin.details: Transfer all balances for a link ID to a recipient with server signature verification Automatically finds all tokens with balance for the given linkId

params.recipient: The address to receive the tokens/ETH
params.serverSignature: The server signature proving the transfer
params.transferId: The UUID (bytes32) transfer ID for the signature

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

withdraw(address,uint256,address,bytes32.details: Withdraw tokens or ETH with server signature verification

params.recipient: The address to receive the tokens/ETH
params.serverSignature: The server signature proving the withdrawal
params.withdrawId: The UUID (bytes32) withdraw ID for the signature
